Package com.ownershiptask.tasks.services

Class ReminderAccessService

java.lang.Object
com.ownershiptask.tasks.services.ReminderAccessService
All Implemented Interfaces:
AccessService
@Service
public class ReminderAccessService
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessService
Implementation of AccessService which makes calculations based on the remainder of the division of the number of files and the number of users.

    • getNumberPossibleAccess

      public int getNumberPossibleAccess​(User user)

      Return the number of possible access to the files. Calculations are based on the remainder of the number of files divided by the number of users.

      There are two possible calculation options and two sub-options for them:

      1. Remainder from division is more than half of the divisor (countIndex >= 0.5):

      1.1 First users will get an integer from division + 1 (relevant + 1). The number of such users is equal to the remainder of the division.

      1.2 The remaining users will receive an integer from the division (relevant).

      2. Remainder from division is less than half of the divisor (countIndex < 0.5):

      2.1 All users will get an integer from the division (relevant).

      2.2 When the number of free files(unOwnedFiles) becomes equal to the remainder of the division(disBalanceFiles), the first users to request will have access to them.

      Each user cannot receive more than BALANCE_STEP + disBalanceFiles(remainder of the division).

      Specified by:
      getNumberPossibleAccess in interface AccessService
      Parameters:
      user - the user whom to count a number of files to access.
      Returns:
      the number of possible access to the files.
